action.action-desc: Mr. Garamendi (for himself, Mr. Larsen of Washington, Mrs. Radewagen, Mr. Sires, Mr. Lowenthal, Mr. Sablan, Ms. Lee of California, Mr. Huffman, Mr. Langevin, Mr. Swalwell, Mr. Kilmer, Ms. DelBene, and Ms. Brownley) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To increase authorizations for the passenger ferry competitive grant program and the ferry boats and terminal facilities formula grant program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Ferry Service Expansion Act.

section.header: Construction of ferry boats and ferry terminal facilities
section.text: Section 147(h) of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking $112,000,000 and inserting $160,000,000;
in paragraph (3), by striking $114,000,000 and inserting $160,000,000;
in paragraph (4), by striking $116,000,000 and inserting $160,000,000; and
in paragraph (5), by striking $118,000,000 and inserting $160,000,000.

section.text: Section 5336(h)(1) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking $30,000,000 and inserting $90,000,000.

subsection.text: Section 133(b)(1)(B)(i) of title 23, United States Code, is amended by inserting , except that for the purposes of this section, hovercraft and terminal facilities for hovercraft engaging in water transit for passengers or vehicles shall be considered to be ferry boats and ferry terminal facilities under section 129(c) after section 129(c).

Any hovercraft funded using funds made available under section 133(b)(1) of title 23, United States Code, shall be deemed to be a vessel subject to chapters 121 and 551 of title 46, United States Code.

section.header: Toll roads, bridges, tunnels, and ferries

subsection.text: Section 129(c)(5) of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the first sentence, by inserting (including between territories of the United States) after adjoining States; and
in the second sentence, by inserting operations between territories of the United States, after United States,.

subsection.text: Section 11117(b) of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (23 U.S.C. 147 note; Public Law 117–58) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking the subsection designation and heading and all that follows through section 147(b) in paragraph (1) and inserting the following:

subsection.text: Notwithstanding section 147(b) of title 23, United States Code

paragraph.text: by striking paragraph (2).

section.text: Section 71103 of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (23 U.S.C. 147 note; Public Law 117–58) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2)(B), by striking located more than 50 sailing miles apart; and
by striking paragraph (3) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: The term rural area means an area that—

subparagraph.text: has not been designated by the Secretary of Commerce in the most recent decennial census as an urbanized area; or

has been designated by the Secretary of Commerce in the most recent decennial census as an urbanized area, but has populations described in subparagraphs (H) and (I) of section 343(a)(13) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1991(a)(13)) that if excluded would result in the area encompassing a population of less than 50,000.

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsections (f) and (g) as subsections (g) and (h), respectively; and
by inserting after subsection (e) the following:

subsection.text: The requirements under sections 5323(j) and 5333 of title 49, United States Code, shall apply to grants under this section.

section.header: Electric or low-emitting ferry pilot program
section.text: Section 71102 of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (23 U.S.C. 147 note; Public Law 117–58) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsection (d) as subsection (e); and
by inserting after subsection (c) the following:

subsection.text: The requirements under sections 5323(j) and 5333 of title 49, United States Code, shall apply to grants under this section.

section.text: The matter under the heading transit infrastructure grants under the heading Federal Transit Administration under the heading Department of Transportation in title VIII of division J of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (Public Law 117–58; 135 Stat. 1437) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (3) by striking the colon at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
$1,250,000,000 shall be to carry out passenger ferry grants under section 5307(h) of title 49, United States Code:

subsection.text: Section 53501(5) of title 46, United States Code, is amended—

by adding at the end the following:
